comments.author: crazy-daniel@gmx.de
comments.text:
Created attachment 522723
small testcase

In an XHTML document that has a 'root' element other than the html element, Select All doesn't work. Neither by right click > Select All nor by Ctrl + A.
comments.raw_text: In an XHTML document that has a 'root' element other than the html element, Select All doesn't work. Neither by right click > Select All nor by Ctrl + A.
comments.creator: crazy-daniel@gmx.de

comments.raw_text:
Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110329 Firefox/4.2a1pre. 
Able to reproduce in firefox 3.6.16 also.
comments.creator: srinivas@smartware.com
comments.text:
Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110329 Firefox/4.2a1pre.

comments.author: srinivas@smartware.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 550039
small testcase (same markup, different media type, and works)

I have discovered that the exact same markup doesn't suffer from this issue if the media type 'text/xml' or 'application/xml' is used instead of 'application/xhtml+xml'.

I don't know what that means implementation wise, but it appears there is some kind of differentiation going on.
comments.creator: crazy-daniel@gmx.de
comments.raw_text:
I have discovered that the exact same markup doesn't suffer from this issue if the media type 'text/xml' or 'application/xml' is used instead of 'application/xhtml+xml'.
